popularityCurve.label: companies make a mistake when they assume that people will come when it's built but then you go to a property and find out that it's empty

it will be a good gesture for them if the tata industry cooperates and returns back the forcefully occupied land i am not talking about 600 acres of land i am talking about the 400 acres of land they should return the forcefully occupied land to the farmers
the land in question are in bits and pieces scattered over the entire project area how can the government return this land we will have to abandon the project then
half way through the process they said they were not even sure they can sell us this land
that would mean we had been wasting our time for the last 18 months or so because they had no authority to sell without reclassifying the land as operational
i'd have real concerns real concerns if council knowingly tried to sell community land
land is not made any more
that's been the goal of the city to acquire the land by sale or by some other method to put it perpetually in public trust
